intro: Colymbada saxicola, commonly known as the rock water-cress, is a small flowering plant native to rocky and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Colymbada saxicola is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas.
